text: Absouya is a department or commune of Oubritenga Province in western Burkina Faso. Its capital lies at the town of Oubritenga. According to the 1996 census the department has a total population of 26,188. ==Towns and villages== * Absouya (2 017 inhabitants) (capital) * Bargo (2 021 inhabitants) * Batenga (650 inhabitants) * Bendogo (2 341 inhabitants) * Bilogtenga (3 216 inhabitants) * Danaogo (1 228 inhabitants) * Gounghin (1 768 inhabitants) * Largo (1 021 inhabitants) * Moanéga (1 789 inhabitants) * Mockin (2 580 inhabitants) * Nabdoghin (1 281 inhabitants) * Nioniogo (1 860 inhabitants) * Sattin (968 inhabitants) * Siguinvoussé (1 036 inhabitants) * Siny (526 inhabitants) * Tambizinsé (390 inhabitants) * Tampaongo (1 496 inhabitants) ==References== Category:Departments of Burkina Faso Category:Oubritenga Province
title: Absouya Department
